# Load Data
```{r load_its2_profiles}

##load in combined Anooj run and Trinity run metadata
sam0 <- read.csv("keysdata/keys_symbiont_metadata.csv", row.names=1)%>%
  clean_names()

sam1 <- as.matrix(sam0)
rownames(sam1) <- sam0$sample_name
sam <- sample_data(data.frame(sam1))

#load in profiles from Anooj run (historical and 2020/2021 contemporary)
tax0 <- read_tsv(
  file = "keysdata/500_20240730T092802_DBV_20240730T195050.profiles.absolute.abund_and_meta.txt",
  n_max = 6) %>%
  dplyr::select(-2) %>% 
  gather(UID, value, -1) %>% 
  spread(1, value) %>%
  clean_names()
tax1 <- as.matrix(tax0[, -1], dimnames = list(tax0$uid, colnames(tax0[-1])))
rownames(tax1) <- tax0$uid
tax <- tax_table(tax1)

#load in profiles from Trinity run (2024 contemporary)
tax10 <- read_tsv(
  file = "keysdata/606_20250710T083602_DBV_20250712T034645.profiles.absolute.abund_and_meta.txt",
  n_max = 6) %>%
  dplyr::select(-2) %>% 
  gather(UID, value, -1) %>% 
  spread(1, value) %>%
  clean_names()
tax11 <- as.matrix(tax10[, -1], dimnames = list(tax10$uid, colnames(tax10[-1])))
rownames(tax11) <- tax10$uid
taxx <- tax_table(tax11)


#load in profiles for OTU analysis from Anooj run (historical and 2020/2021 contemporary )
otu0 <- read_tsv(
  file = "keysdata/500_20240730T092802_DBV_20240730T195050.profiles.absolute.abund_and_meta.txt") %>% 
  rename(sample_name = "...2") %>%
  dplyr::select(-1) %>%
  slice(7:n()) %>%
  mutate_at(2:ncol(.), as.numeric)
otu1 <- as.matrix(otu0[, -1])
rownames(otu1) <- otu0$sample_name
otu <- otu_table(otu1, taxa_are_rows = FALSE)

#load in profiles for OTU analysis from Trinity run (2024 contemporary)
otu10 <- read_tsv(
  file = "keysdata/606_20250710T083602_DBV_20250712T034645.profiles.absolute.abund_and_meta.txt") %>% 
  rename(sample_name = "...2") %>%
  dplyr::select(-1) %>%
  slice(7:n()) %>%
  mutate_at(2:ncol(.), as.numeric)
otu11 <- as.matrix(otu10[, -1])
rownames(otu11) <- otu10$sample_name
otuu <- otu_table(otu11, taxa_are_rows = FALSE)


profiles1 <- phyloseq(otuu, taxx, sam)

profiles2 <-phyloseq(otu, tax, sam)

#melt Anooj data  into dataframe 
df<-psmelt(profiles2)

#melt Trinity data into dataframe 
df1<-psmelt(profiles1)

#combine into one dataframe 
df2<-rbind(df, df1)

#filter out low abundance (zero from errors in adding the primers) and samples with G as the major clade 
df2<-df2%>%
  filter(Abundance!="0")%>%
  filter(clade!="G")

#separate out year and plot total major clades by era 
df2<-df2%>% mutate(year = substr(collection_date, 1, 4))

eras<-data.frame(year=c("2001", "2002", "2003", "2020", "2021", "2024"), 
                    era=c("historical", "historical", "historical", "contemporary_pre2023", "contemporary_pre2023", "contemporary_post2023"))

df3<-left_join(eras, df2, by=c("year"))

df3$era<-factor(df3$era, levels=c("historical", "contemporary_pre2023", "contemporary_post2023"))
ggplot(df3, aes(x=era, fill=clade))+geom_bar(alpha=1)+facet_wrap(~species_code)


```

# Get just dominant symbiont (>50% relative abundance within each sample)
```{r}
df3dom <- df3 %>%
  group_by(sample_name) %>%
  filter(Abundance == max(Abundance))

df3dom %>%
  group_by(species_code) %>%
  summarise(doms = paste(unique(clade), collapse = ", ")) %>%
  arrange(species_code) %>%
  print(n = nrow(.))

# Check out new records
# DLAB with A -- KL-250, R414, R339
df3dom %>%
  filter(species_code == "DLAB", clade == "A")
# present in one historcal and two post-2023 (still recovering from bleaching?)
df3 %>% filter(sample_name == "KL-250")

# PCLI with A --
df3dom %>%
  filter(species_code == "PCLI", clade == "A")
# present in one post-2023 (still recovering from bleaching?)

# PSTR with A --
df3dom %>%
  filter(species_code == "PSTR", clade == "A")
# present in two post-2023 (still recovering from bleaching?)
```






```{r proportions, fig.width=15,fig.height=10}

#now we want to calculate the proportions of each sample size that is D so we can plot change in proportion over eras/years 


prop<-df3%>%
  group_by(species_code, era)%>%
 mutate(
    total = n())+
  summarize(
    total_A = sum(clade == "A", na.rm = TRUE),
    total_B = sum(clade=="B", na.rm=TRUE),
    total_C = sum(clade=="C", na.rm=TRUE),
    total_D = sum(clade=="D", na.rm=TRUE)
  )

prop <- df3 %>%
  group_by(species_code, era) %>%
  summarise(
    total = n(),
    total_A = sum(clade == "A", na.rm = TRUE),
    total_B = sum(clade == "B", na.rm = TRUE),
    total_C = sum(clade == "C", na.rm = TRUE),
    total_D = sum(clade == "D", na.rm = TRUE),
    prop_A = total_A / total,
    prop_B = total_B / total,
    prop_C = total_C / total,
    prop_D = total_D / total,
    .groups = "drop"
  )


prop_long <- prop %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = starts_with("prop_"),
    names_to = "clade",
    names_prefix = "prop_",
    values_to = "prop"
  )

#remove all species that don't have replicates across all eras
#prop_long<- prop_long %>%
 # group_by(species_code) %>%
  #filter(n_distinct(era) == 3) %>%
  #ungroup()

#prop_long<-prop_long%>%
#  filter(total>=10)

#remove species code UNK
prop_long<-prop_long%>%filter(species_code!="UNK")


#write csv 
write.csv(prop_long, file="replicates_keys_proportion.csv")

prop_long_filtered <- prop_long %>%
  group_by(species_code, era) %>%
  slice(1) %>%  # ensure one row per species_code-era for total
  group_by(species_code) %>%
  filter(n_distinct(era) == 3, all(total >= 5)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  semi_join(prop_long, ., by = c("species_code", "era")) %>%
  mutate(clade = factor(clade, levels = c("C", "B", "A", "D")))


#plot 
prop_long_filtered2 <- prop_long_filtered %>% filter(species_code %in% c("CNAT", "DLAB", "OFAV", "PSTR"))
ggplot(prop_long_filtered2, aes(x=era, y=prop, fill=clade))+geom_col(alpha=0.8)+facet_nested(~ species_code)+ylab("Proportion of Colonies")+
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1))+xlab("") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c(
  "#2A9D8F",  # cool: teal green
  "#457B9D",   # cool: desaturated blue
  "#F4A261",  # warm: muted orange
  "#E63946")) + # warm: soft crimson
  scale_x_discrete(labels = c("2003", "2023", "2024"))






```

```{r symbiont broken up by year}
propy <- df3 %>%
  group_by(species_code, year) %>%
  summarise(
    total = n(),
    total_A = sum(clade == "A", na.rm = TRUE),
    total_B = sum(clade == "B", na.rm = TRUE),
    total_C = sum(clade == "C", na.rm = TRUE),
    total_D = sum(clade == "D", na.rm = TRUE),
    prop_A = total_A / total,
    prop_B = total_B / total,
    prop_C = total_C / total,
    prop_D = total_D / total,
    .groups = "drop"
  )


prop_longy <- propy %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = starts_with("prop_"),
    names_to = "clade",
    names_prefix = "prop_",
    values_to = "prop"
  )

prop_longy<- prop_longy %>%
  group_by(species_code) %>%
  filter(n_distinct(year) == 2) %>%
  ungroup()

prop_longy<-prop_longy%>%
  filter(total>=10)

#remove species with no replicates across eras 

ggplot(prop_longy, aes(x=year, y=prop, fill=clade))+geom_col(alpha=0.8)+facet_nested(~ species_code)+ylab("Proportion of Colonies")+
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 50, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1))


```



```{r}
df3 %>%
  filter(!species_code == "UNK") %>%
  filter(!era == "contemporary_post2023") %>%
  distinct(era, collection_site, species_code) %>%
  arrange(collection_site, species_code, era)

df3f <- df3 %>%
  filter(species_code != "UNK",
         era != "contemporary_post2023") %>%
  group_by(collection_site, species_code, era) %>%
  tally(name = "n_obs") %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  # keep only species with â‰¥3 in each era at that site
  group_by(collection_site, species_code) %>%
  filter(all(c("historical", "contemporary_pre2023") %in% era),
         min(n_obs) >= 3) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  # join back to keep full records from df3
  inner_join(df3, by = c("collection_site", "species_code", "era"))

df3f_summary <- df3f %>%
  group_by(collection_site, species_code, era, clade) %>%
  summarise(n = n(), .groups = "drop")

ggplot(df3f_summary, aes(x = era, y = n, fill = clade)) +
  geom_col(position = "stack") +
  facet_grid(species_code ~ collection_site, scales = "free_y") +
  labs(x = "Era", y = "Count of clade") +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))
```
